intro: Godetia amoena var. albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, white-veined stems and clusters of small, showy yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It is often grown as an ornamental plant in gardens due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
